name: Hotel Albert 1er

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't be put off by the faded decor and knocked-about furniture and fittings: this hotel is a no-frills gem! It's perfectly positioned, just off the beach and the promenade, next to the main square, and very near the pedestrianised area where you'll find a huge choice of restaurants. The marina is a brisk walk around the headland. Several large, expensive (23.50 euros/day) underground car parks are nearby, but buses to/from the airport (which is inaudible, yet only 4 miles away) pass right by the hotel anyway. Some rooms look across the lush gardens with views of the sea between the palm trees. The rooms are well cleaned, equipped to 3-star standard and everything works, especially the all-important power-showers. The towels and bed linen are of good quality and the lack of drinks facilities in the rooms is made up for by the chilled vending machines in the lounge. Double glazing, shutters and heavy (though dingy) curtains keep the noise of traffic out at night (and also the sound of occasional open-air concerts in the park, if those aren't your thing), while air-conditioning keeps the temperature manageable. However, you'll want to keep the windows open to enjoy all the hustle & bustle of the city, even in the afternoon when the sun beats into the rooms from the west. Best of all are the staff, however, who are friendly, hard working and good at their jobs. The hot & cold buffet breakfast, served from 7am until a lazy 10.30am in the quaint little lounge on the first floor, is worth the 11 euros, but you'll have to do everything for yourself at busy times. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and will not hesitate to stay at the Albert 1er again. Those who expect more, in this location and at these prices, are barking up the wrong tree. It must be the best value-for-money in Nice.
reviews.title: A No-Frills Gem!

reviews.text: I was completely surprised at how much I liked this hotel after reading some of the old reviews. The review that was posted just before mine is 100% correct. This is a fantastic location at a fraction of the cost of the surrounding hotels.
reviews.title: Surprise!

reviews.text: From the window, I overlooked the beautiful gardens of the Albert 1er Gardens and I could see the Mediterranean, as well as the Place Massena.
reviews.title: Great Location-great price!!

likes.liked: — location and price - real value for money
likes.disliked: — the furniture is getting a bit tired

reviews.text: The room was perfectly clean and the bed was comfortable. I was very happy and would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Run Down Albert
bring ear plugs and matress
reviews.text: What a great location and it's only 3 stars with a 3 star price!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not stay here! My boyfriend and I both had money stolen on more than one occasion from our hotel room, both of us are 99% sure it was the maids who "cleaned" our room because there was no sign of forced entry. The manager was incredibly dismissive and rude when we informed him of the first incident. He told us casually that if we got a signed police declaration we would get our money back and be able to pay for our planned trip to Monte Carlo. So off we trekked in the 30 degree sunshine to the other side of town (45minute walk either way), got said declaration, came back and were told that we'd get it back in a couple of weeks! Still not got it incidentally! And wasted practically a whole day of our one week holiday for nothing! Not even so much as an apology from the manager or any indication that he or his colleagues actually cared that their staff had stolen their guests' money (which had been hidden in a wallet amongst my clothes in a drawer, how intrusive as well!). And it happened again on our last day! The hotel's only plus point was its great location so you could get away easily!
reviews.title: Albert Premiere my derriere!

reviews.text: This hotel has a great location - my wife particularly liked it because the 'posh street' (Louis Vuitton and Chanel) was just over the other side of the Albert 1er park. The rooms are basic and a bit worn, but comfortable, and they have good air-con which is much needed in July. Night-time goings-on can be heard through the inter connecting doors, much to our amusement, and no doubt to our son's amusement too. In-house breakfast is 11 euros each a day, we found it much better to go to the local market or a cafe for breakfast. Postcards are only posted for you once a week so post your own! Watch out for jellyfish which are a problem, especially when the sea has been rough. The beaches are pebbles, there are public beaches mingled between private beaches.
reviews.title: Albert 1er - a good base for your holiday

likes.disliked: — Lots of stairs and dated decor

reviews.title: faded elegance
reviews.text: The buses are very good and very cheap - only 1 euro 30 cents each to get to Monte Carlo (about 20 minutes away). Catch the bus from the port in Nice to Monte Carlo, but take a boat trip to St Tropez as the coast road is very busy in July and August - this boat trip was quite pricey but much more worth it than taking a boat trip to Monte Carlo. We thought that St Tropez was quite disappointing and out of the two, Monte Carlo was a much better day out.

the lovely position helpful staff and interconnecting rooms with sea view balconies( pay extra but worth it )almost make up for the strange decor and slightly worn interior the rooms were clean and fine for a family go out for breakfast if you can
reviews.title: Cute little hotel!

reviews.text: Sorry my pictures are so dark. I meant to flip on the flash and forgot. It really wasn't that dark!! I really liked staying here. I was nervous after the reviews but found it cute and charming. Not many frills but a friendly staff and a perfect location. We went to Old Town almost daily and it was right near the flower market. I would totally recommend anyone staying here.
reviews.title: Budget priced - budget amenities - you get what you pay for

reviews.text: Be very careful! They will take extra money for breakfast. Do not use your credit card! Total price was 270.-, but they took off from my credit card 317.-. No explanation, pure arrogance.
reviews.title: Be very careful!

reviews.text: This was certainly one of my worst hotel experience ever having travelled regularly all over the world in the last 15 years. While the sign in front of the hotel showed '3 -star', the quality of the hotel was in fact inferior to the worst no-star generic motels along US highways that I have stayed at in the past.
reviews.title: Definitely not here
Hotel Albert 1er
reviews.text: Upon checking in, we found that the elevator was old and never really worked properly. One couldn't press more than one floor and expected it to stop at the right places. When we entered our room, it was a bad surprise to find out that the twin room that we had booked was in fact a single. The hotel staff was most unhelpful and steadfastly refused to do anything about it beside offering to put in another set of bedsheets. She even argued with me repeatedly that the room had a 'big' bed and should be ok for 2 large adults even though it was smaller than a standard US queen-size bed. In general the condition of the room was terrible. The furnitures were simply very old and most were not working properly (closet didn't close, bed was too short for my 5-9ft frame, connecting door to adjacent room had huge gaping keyhole, TV was about 10 inches with shoddy remote, and the main neon light in the room kept blinking all night long after it had been turned off). Also, the wall was extremely thin and we could hear people talking and door slamming up until almost 4am in the morning. The bathroom didn't fare much better. The shower head holder was broken and I had to tied it back with an extra towel. The sink and tiles there were also very old and badly maintained.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a supposedly 3-star hotel, the staff fell way short of expectation. We asked a reception how to get to the Matisse museum (a major tourist site) and she couldn't even tell us exatly what bus to take. Upon arriving there, we found out that the museum had been closed for renovation for the past 5 months - another fact that we were not warned in advance.
reviews.title: All About the convenience

reviews.text: All in all, this hotel was a terrible choice. While the location was great, there were many other far superior hotels in the same area in the same price bracket. Basically only stay here if you only intend to never sleep nor use the bathroom and will only use the room to store your luggage!
reviews.title: Nice hotel!

reviews.text: I had to stay at Nice for business during the time when the MIPIM (real estate fair at Cannes) was on and all the hotels were fully-booked. Therefore had to do with the Albert 1er, at a very steep price for what it is. An extremely busy road just underneath the room whose thin windows did not shut out the noise. Other people have complained about the very thin walls and the connecting door - I can confirm this. Everything is very old, no money seems to have been spent for improvements, no personal touches anywhere. No lobby, no sitting room, average breakfast not included in price. Positives: Definitely the location within the town, very friendly staff, clean room, bed narrow but firm. Do make sure you never stay at Nice during the MIPIM (always the same week in March) - the airport can hardly cope with the number of flights and people.
reviews.title: Good location, not more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in 05, July. We felt that we got what we paid for. Location is fantastic, with everything you would need (buses, beach, Old City, stores, etc.) within walking distance.
reviews.title: Good Value, Meets Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the Hotel, remember, this is Continental Europe. Hotels are not up to American or UK standards. The walls are thin (you may hear your neigbors enjoying their romantic vacation). It probably could have used some updating when we were there. Other than that, no issues. We didn't need to interact with hotel staff, and did not take advantage of breakfast.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Deal for a Basic Hotel

reviews.text: If you set your expectations appropriately, you probably will not be disapointed. Overall, we got our money's worth from this hotel.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location
reviews.user: is it hot or is it me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was basic. It was no frills. Perhaps if we had a sea view it would have been a bit more exciting. For 60 Euro, it was a fantastic bargain because of the location. My wife and I would stay there again for the right price. If it wouldn't have been so inexpensive, I would have rated it a 3, but because of the price, I give it a 4.
reviews.title: A Little Gem
